intro: Carex gracilis, commonly known as slender sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikelets of flowers. Native to wet or moist environments, it thrives in marshes, bogs, and along stream banks. The plant has a rhizomatous root system that helps it spread and stabilize soil. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological restoration projects.
